intro: Momisia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth momisia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Momisia laevigata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
